alert.note: Alert for Alameda; Contra Costa (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 25 at 10:36AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, Alameda and Contra Costa. * WHEN...Until 1215 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1032 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - The CHP incident page is reporting flooding across portions of the East Bay, including Oakland. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oakland, Concord, Berkeley, Richmond, San Leandro, Mountain View, Alameda, San Ramon, Walnut Creek, Pittsburg, Danville, Martinez, Pleasant Hill, San Pablo, Lafayette, El Cerrito, Castro Valley, San Lorenzo, Hercules and Albany. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
